page.title: 07Oldham Batteries.
page.content: Oldham Batteries is an established Denton company having originally set up a factory here in 1865.Initially it produced machinary for the hatting industry.The company was family run until the early 1970's when it was taken over the by Hawker Siddeley group. Presently it produces not only car batteries but also batteries used by the Ministry of Defence.These must be rugged,have a long shelf life,be ready for instant action and be reliable as they are used for activating missiles. A recent development for the mining industry are methalarm lamps these flash automatically when unacceptable levels of methane are present. There are Oldham's depots nationwide and it is not unusual to see their name in many countries as 25% of their product is exported.
